storyInfo: In Gladiia's pursuit of Ægir technology, she destroys an experimentation site used by the Church of the Deep, and comes to know there are other hunters who survived. At this moment, someone appears, who suggests they work together.

attributes.content: 5:18 P.M. \ Overcast
Primavera City, Iberia, in a certain chapel
Oh! How long has someone been at the pews?
attributes.name: Pious Youth

attributes.content: Ma'am, have you been sitting here this whole time?
attributes.name: Pious Youth

attributes.content: I passed by just a moment ago, and I didn't see you...
attributes.name: Pious Youth

attributes.content: You were focused on this... instrument made of some type of plant tissue, you were using it to polish the floor.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Er, do you mean my broom? Yes, I'm sweeping the floor right now.
attributes.name: Pious Youth

attributes.content: Please excuse me; I did not intend to disturb your work. After all, it seems you'll be busy for quite some time.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: No, it's okay, haha. This doesn't really count as work. I'm just a layman, and I sometimes come help clean the chapel.
attributes.name: Pious Youth

attributes.content: I've never seen you before. Are you an Ægir too?
attributes.name: Pious Youth

attributes.content: ...Ægir?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Your use of 'too' may not be so accurate.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: I—I'm sorry! That's my misunderstanding, then, I didn't mean to regard you as one of us...
attributes.name: Pious Youth

attributes.content: Physiologically, you're not mistaken.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Oh... do you come from another city, then?
attributes.name: Pious Youth

attributes.content: You might say so. I only arrived a few months ago.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Your journey can't have been easy. It never is for us Ægir.
attributes.name: Pious Youth

attributes.content: It has definitely been exhausting.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: If you have any questions, just feel free to ask...
attributes.name: Pious Youth

attributes.content: Good. Since you are still willing to call yourself Ægir, I do find something very curious—
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: The nation you once belonged to had relentless cleaning devices. Not a speck of dust was allowed to settle on the streets.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: May I ask why you endure such a filthy, inefficient life now?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: *Sigh*. None of us want to. The disaster fifty years ago changed Iberia.
attributes.name: Pious Youth

attributes.content: Iberia?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: No, I was not referring to this dry country.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Then you mean... all the Ægir settlements from before?
attributes.name: Pious Youth

attributes.content: I've only ever heard my grandpa mentioning them—*cough*. Ma'am, those underwater cities are all abandoned now. They say they're incredibly dangerous, whether to us islanders, or to Iberia.
attributes.name: Pious Youth

attributes.content: You listened to the birds.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Though it only scratches the surface, you still carry a portion of Ægir knowledge and technology.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Why would you consider yourself yet inferior to the barbarians of dry land?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: It's... not to say we're inferior, but... ma'am, it's best the Penal Battalion doesn't overhear this. It hasn't been easy for us to stay in this city, so near the blockade line...
attributes.name: Pious Youth

attributes.content: Cowardice, and misgiving.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: In Ægir, with a child that posed such problems, the parents would be stripped by law of the chance to raise progeny.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Ah... that sounds a little frightening.
attributes.name: Pious Youth

attributes.content: Is it frightening? It seems you've completely forgotten your own originating way of life. The dwellers of land have already assimilated you, whole.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Living here in Iberia, acting too unlike everyone else is a very risky thing.
attributes.name: Pious Youth

attributes.content: I comprehend your choice.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Ma'am... you seem disappointed, in a way.
attributes.name: Pious Youth

attributes.content: Disappointment requires a hope before it.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Perhaps this was not all you brought ashore, but clearly, searching will still require more time.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Ma'am, I don't think I understand even half of what you're saying.
attributes.name: Pious Youth

attributes.content: I am not too familiar with this manner of communication yet.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Your wording is also... very strange. It reminds me a little of those revues that people liked decades ago...
attributes.name: Pious Youth

attributes.content: Are those works of art no longer popular?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: How regrettable. I quite appreciated them.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: So you only intone like this because you like it...
attributes.name: Pious Youth

attributes.content: And you would not achieve rapid grasp of an unfamiliar language by way of audiovisual storage discs?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: We really couldn't.
attributes.name: Pious Youth

attributes.content: Understandable.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: And, generally speaking, it's not because we're too stupid...
attributes.name: Pious Youth

attributes.content: Of course there can be other explanations.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: *Sigh*... Ma'am, if I offend you again, I apologize... You seem like you aren't well. Are you ill?
attributes.name: Pious Youth

attributes.content: Dry-land pathogens would be hard-pressed to cause any harm to my bodily functions.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: As for emotional ailment, perhaps. After all, it's too dry here.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: I've only ever heard complaints that this season in Iberia is too moist.
attributes.name: Pious Youth

attributes.content: In any case, as long as you aren't sick. Of course, if you feel unwell at all, you can seek help from the priests.
attributes.name: Pious Youth

attributes.content: Faith.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: You do not harbor faith in science nor technology, nor the nation itself, but invest your ideals in an... impurity that lacks reliability.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Of course, I've recently come to realize, it's also an effective means to accomplish a mutual deception on the power of an informational asymmetry.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: It's possible you've misunderstood. I don't feel that illness can be cured just by thumbing through a holy book or listening to a sermon...
attributes.name: Pious Youth

attributes.content: You exceed expectations.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Ha... haha... Ma'am, you really do have a special sense of humor.
attributes.name: Pious Youth

attributes.content: What I wanted to say was, the people of the Church are very giving, and they've even recently extended shelter to some Ori... er, some sick. They and the sick are all Ægir alike.
attributes.name: Pious Youth

attributes.content: Apart from chatting with 'Ægir' such as you, the conduct of the Church you speak of also constitutes my reason for coming here.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Is that so? You came looking for someone ill?
attributes.name: Pious Youth

attributes.content: Supposing who I thought to seek really was here, then...
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Antonio, why does the window on the west have a big hole in it?
attributes.name: Church Staff

attributes.content: A hole? It was broken about ten minutes ago, all in a flash. I'd guessed it was the Penal Battalion arresting someone...
attributes.name: Pious Youth

attributes.content: May I suggest to you something?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Ma'am, what is it you want to say?
attributes.name: Pious Youth

attributes.content: Leave, now.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: A—An armband? A Battalion armband? Y—You're from the Battalion? It's no wonder you're so peculiar... I never even realized!
attributes.name: Pious Youth

attributes.content: Officer, th—thank you for letting me free! I'll leave right away!
attributes.name: Pious Youth

attributes.content: Remember to close the door.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Not bad. The military organizations of dry land may appear ineffective, the soldiers' technology feeble and pitiful, but to those even weaker, deterrent power is still expressible.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Moreover, I am very glad to see none of you have left.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: This will save me some minor time.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: The scent...
attributes.name: Church Staff

attributes.content: Please come closer.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: *sniff*... *sniff* *sniff*... You're not the Penal Battalion... What do you want?
attributes.name: Church Staff

attributes.content: I had thought you would be capable of more kindly language.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: After all, when I saw how the technology you use was more complete than those runaways', I'd had a shred of hope for you.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Technology...? We do not understand what you speak of.
attributes.name: Church Staff

attributes.content: Originium. This special energy source, both dangerous and with potential, does not exist on the seafloor.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Curiosity in energy sources is not at all strange.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: No one on dry land has been able to reproduce Ægir's original form, and due to this, I have seen in this nation of Iberia a vast array of technologies composited with no concern for beauty whatsoever.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: However, you are unlike those runaways who forced themselves to integrate into this dry country. You use Ægir technology to purify Originium, and undoubtedly harbor further plans.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: We... help...
attributes.name: Church Staff

attributes.content: Help through giving? Only the naive would believe it.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: They know not where all those sick ultimately disappear to, and I have found traces of Ægir technology on the bodies of those unfortunate experiments.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: You... found them?
attributes.name: Church Staff

attributes.content: It was in no way difficult.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: You aim to transform each and every body. Such technology requires dozens of procedures. And how far have your doings progressed? Perhaps the first procedure, or the second?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: The runaways who fled ashore prior to that first contact could not have grasped these procedures.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: As for they, they have occupied the channel between the ocean and the land. If even I have no way to return, none of you could possibly emerge by normal means either.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: How have you, long used to walking on dry land, managed to sustain contact with the ocean?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Or could it be... some have brought the filthiest trash of the sea ashore with them?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Who are you?
attributes.name: Church Staff

attributes.content: I'm fed up with this game of mutual identification. Such a cliché oughtn't be present in dry land's theater.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Gladiia weightlessly brandishes her lance. An alloy not known to land strikes stone brick at a speed the naked eye cannot perceive. With her at the center, the chapel's entire floor roars as it subsides.
As I expected.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Did you deliberately construct such an inferior experimentation site below a masquerade of a building, simply to trick the landwalkers' gaze?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Moreover, I'm astonished these petty tricks could actually win such outstanding results.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: I once again must reassess the grade of these land nations' organizations.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: *cough*... *cough* *cough*! This weapon of yours! And your strength... is this Originium Arts?
attributes.name: Church Staff

attributes.content: Heh, Originium Arts.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: It—It couldn't be... you... you're...
attributes.name: Church Staff

attributes.content: If... you're the one the bishops spoke of... then you should've been gravely wounded months ago!
attributes.name: Church Staff

attributes.content: You know of what occurred three months ago on the seafloor?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: You've met someone else on the shore.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Who was it—that you met?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: This speed... *wheeze*... *wheeze*... Why were you unmoving before?
attributes.name: Church Staff

attributes.content: I am tired of moving on dry land.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: If standing still will dispose of you shameful ambling trash, why should I waste the further energy?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: I... I do not know... We only guard... You may not destroy this place...
attributes.name: Church Staff

attributes.content: Quite right. You are inferior, and there are limits to the faith you grasp.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Then I can only change to a different topic.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: How many more individuals do you keep on dry land?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: How many more plots do you plot against Ægir?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: And—why—do you research artificial integration of Originium with Ægir bodies?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: *wheeze*... *sniff*... *sniff*... The scent...
attributes.name: Church Staff

attributes.content: Don't waste the energy.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Turning into Sea Terrors will only hasten your deaths.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: It... It couldn't... aaarghhhh—!
attributes.name: Church Staff

attributes.content: Perfect. (Ægirian) I wanted you to die a little faster, anyhow.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: So frail that a single sweep destroys you all.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Urgh—
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: This... gripe in my stomach... is back again. Ever since I came ashore, it hasn't ceased.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: These morons that couldn't even turn fully into Sea Terrors... I see I'm suited only to slaughtering such prey here!
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: And these... Ægir who came ashore, they've all become indistinguishable from land-dwellers.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: How long does it take, from leaving the seawater, to the last hint of moisture evaporating from the body?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Whether this end, or another, no matter which...
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: No... I cannot...!
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: (Vomits)
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: But...
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.text: ...are there others who truly yet live?
If there are, how much time must I spend before I can rescue them?
Gladiia senses her internal temperature still rapidly rising, just as it does on the surface of her body.

attributes.content: Do not stop, you waste.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Though I cannot return to Ægir... no, precisely because I cannot return for now, I must do this.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.text: Retrieve my hunter. Continue to fulfill my duty.
Fight on without rest or pause.

attributes.content: ...Who is it?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: (Shriek)
I suggest you halt your attack.
Though your strength is uncommon, I'm afraid no one can force me to halt.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Once more, and this chapel will collapse.
You don't pay mind to the Penal Battalion, but I guarantee you, not even you would want to catch the eye of Iberia's Inquisitors.
Land bird...
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: This meaningless clashing will only slow your search for your comrades.
(Ægirian) Perhaps the nation of the seafloor can still wait.
(Ægirian) For the stranded hunters, there is no such guarantee.
You... You know of Ægir?! You even know our...
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Three months oh-seven days ago, fierce oceanbound visions once again manifested in the seas south of Iberia. This information was rapidly curtailed by Iberia's government, but I had my own means to learn of it.
You sought me intentionally. And perhaps you found this place too, like I did?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: You can so much as fully understand. I've been waiting for you, and waiting for a very long time.
You've been sent ashore by an exceptional current. It may be extremely painful for you, but for us and Ægir, it is a chance.
You are not hostile. Or else, your revealing this information would have sufficed for me to take your life.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: You could do so, but—there is no need for it.
You have amply sensed that I and the sea have no connection. But in reality, between dry land and the ocean, no distance separates.
The ocean in its pride may rarely notice the land, but the land cannot stand by as it sees disaster unfolding in the ocean.
Since my coming here... you are the first to instill awe in me.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: You are very well aware, this is not a place for conversation.
Moreover, with how you've dragged your badly injured body to an unfamiliar environment, you cannot hold out for much longer.
Long enough for me to find and cut this trash to pieces.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: You know this battle will continue for a very long time.
If they weren't so good at hiding, would Ægir have allowed them to last this long?
What they are and do does not amount to a threat against Ægir.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: You think to draw a distinction between them and they, but I'm afraid that's not how they themselves think.
Will you remain here, continuing to charge me with lance in hand, or shall you leave, together with me, so we can discuss a possible collaboration—
The choice is yours.
Ægir's fate, and that of your comrades, Iberia and even this great land... all rest in your hands.
Before we initiate discussion as to specific matters of cooperation, would you first tell me your name?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Of course.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit
